column4: I'm trying to do an XP dual boot, both are installed and in grub, but it won't boot XP, says it cannot find kernel
no... everything is just the same.  I just resized the Ubuntu partition, installed XP on it, and got it into the grub menu
how did you get it into your grub menu ?
anychance you can post your menu.lst in a pastebn website ?
can you link me to a pastebin?  I've never used one before
are you certan the  winxp install is on the 2nd partition ?
well, the xp install read the partition between the ubuntu partition and the swap space
a quick trial and error thing to do would be to 'e' the line in grub and change the 1 to 2 then 3 then 4 ... just incase its hanging out on some weird partition number
K, thanks.  I'll be back on in a bit if I can't get that working
